ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Soloing bards
ygData.msgSnippet: Kit: In the instance he described, there was no ench. If there is a better song to play, tell us what it is.  Just because some other class has a better damage
ygData.messageBody:
Kit:

In the instance he described, there was no ench. If there is a better song
to play, tell us what it is. Just because some other class has a better
damage shield, that is not a reason to just instantly dismiss bard's damage
shield songs. Also depending on the level of the bard - there might not be
that many other better options. You can be 31 and be in assn room or you
can be 44 - big difference in what your choices are.

Point is, he gave us a specific situation, I answered with some points about
the specific songs. Please share, but be specific about what songs a - say
33 - bard could use for that room - given the group he was in.

Sylly


-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2001 3:50 PM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Soloing bards


I've always had a problem with our damage shields actually. Unless you are
being attacked by multiple mobs, which with an enchanter doesn't happen too
often, the damage output of the shields is sub-par. We have several other
options which produce more damage per 6 second pulse. About the only time
we've used the damage shields was in multi-bard groups. There's almost
always a better song to play than a damage shield
